PARAGRAPH.STRING: also Gunung Semeru - is the tallest mountain on the island of Java and one of its most active volcanoes. Known also as Mahameru (Great Mountain),
rises abruptly above the coastal plains of eastern Java. Maars containing crater lakes have formed along a line through the summit.
lies at the south end of the Tengger Volcanic Complex.

eruptive history is extensive. Since 1818, at least 55 eruptions have been recorded (10 of which resulted in fatalities) consisting of both lava flows and pyroclastic flows. Moderate explosive eruptions (VEI 2-3) have also been recorded with some regularity.
has been in a state of near-constant eruption from 1967 to the present. At times, small eruptions happen every 10 minutes or so.
is regularly climbed by tourists, usually starting from the village of Rano Pani to the north, but though non-technical
can be dangerous. Soe Hok Gie, an Indonesian political activist of the 1960s died in 1969 from inhaling poisonous gas while hiking on
